de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.model.datastructure
Interface ObservableArtefact

All Known Subinterfaces:
Controller
All Known Implementing Classes:
Artefact, ControllerImpl
public interface ObservableArtefact

To be able to update the view whenever a change in the model layer occurs, we use the Observer Pattern to get along with it.

Observer Pattern
Observer defines a one-to-many dependency between objects, so that when one object changes state, all its dependents are notified and updated automatically.

This defines the subject to observe. It's possible that more objects (observers) observe a subject (observable). But there's always only one subject to observe. That's the one-to-many dependency. Many observers, but one subject.

Since:
Mar/24/09
Version:
0.1
Author:
Michael Munz

 void removeObserverArtefact(ObserverArtefact observer, ArtefactType type)
          Likewise, when an observer wants to un-register, we just take it off the list.
 

Method Detail

registerObserverArtefact

void registerObserverArtefact(ObserverArtefact observer,
                              ArtefactType type)
When an observer registers, we just add it to the end of an observer list.

Parameters:
observer - an object to notify when an change occurs.
type - type of artefact to observe

removeObserverArtefact

void removeObserverArtefact(ObserverArtefact observer,
                            ArtefactType type)
Likewise, when an observer wants to un-register, we just take it off the list.

Parameters:
observer - an object which doesn't want any notifications anymore.
type - the type of artefact to remove observer

notifyObserverArtefact

void notifyObserverArtefact()
Here's the fun part; this is where we tell all observers about the state. Because they are all Observers, we know they all implement update(), so we know how to notify them.
